name: Sanjeev Kapoor
bio: Sanjeev Kapoor is a renowned Indian celebrity chef, entrepreneur, and television personality. He is widely regarded as one of the most popular chefs in India, and has made significant contributions to the Indian culinary world.

recipi1.name: Butter Chicken
recipi1.ingredients: 500g boneless chicken,1 cup yoghurt, 1 tbsp ginger paste, 1 tbsp garlic paste,1 tsp red chilli powder
recipi1.cooking_method: Marinate chicken with yoghurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, and chilli powder. Grill until cooked. For the gravy, heat butter and add onions, ginger-garlic paste, tomato puree, and spices. Cook until thickened. Add the grilled chicken to the gravy and cook for a few minutes. Serve hot.

recipi2.name: Palak Paneer
recipi2.ingredients: 1 bunch spinach,200g paneer,1 onion, 1 tsp ginger paste,1 tsp garlic paste
recipi2.cooking_method: Blanch spinach and blend into a puree. Heat oil and fry onions until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and spices. Cook until fragrant. Add spinach puree and cook until thickened. Add paneer cubes and cook until heated through. Serve hot.

recipi3.name: Chicken Biryani
recipi3.ingredients: 500g chicken,2 cups basmati rice,1 onion,1 tsp ginger paste,1 tsp garlic paste
recipi3.cooking_method: Marinate chicken with yoghurt, ginger-garlic paste, and spices. Cook rice with spices and set aside. Fry onions until golden brown. Add chicken and cook until tender. Layer chicken and rice in a pot and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes. Serve hot.

name: Vikas Khanna
bio: Vikas Khanna is a highly acclaimed Indian-American Michelin-starred chef, restaurateur, cookbook author, filmmaker, and humanitarian. He is known for his innovative cooking style, which combines traditional Indian flavors with modern techniques.

recipi1.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
recipi1.ingredients: 500g boneless chicken,1 cup yoghurt,1 onion,1 tbsp ginger paste,1 tbsp garlic paste
recipi1.cooking_method: Marinate chicken with yoghurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, and spices. Grill until cooked. For the gravy, heat butter and add onions, ginger-garlic paste, tomato puree, and spices. Cook until thickened. Add the grilled chicken to the gravy and cook for a few minutes. Serve hot.

recipi2.name: Lamb Biryani
recipi2.ingredients: 500g lamb,2 cups basmati rice,1 onion,1 tsp ginger paste,1 tsp garlic paste
recipi2.cooking_method: Marinate lamb with yoghurt, ginger-garlic paste, and spices. Cook rice with spices and set aside. Fry onions until golden brown. Add lamb and cook until tender. Layer lamb and rice in a pot and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes. Serve hot.

recipi3.name: Chana Masala
recipi3.ingredients: 2 cups chickpeas,1 onion,1 tomato,1 tsp ginger paste,1 tsp garlic paste
recipi3.cooking_method: Soak chickpeas overnight. Boil until cooked. Fry onions until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste, tomato, and spices. Cook until thickened. Add chickpeas and cook for a few minutes. Serve hot.

name: Ranveer Brar
bio: Ranveer Brar is a popular Indian chef, television personality, and author. He is known for his innovative cooking style, which combines traditional Indian flavors with modern techniques.

recipi1.name: Butter Garlic Prawns
recipi1.ingredients: 500g prawns,2 tbsp butter,1 tbsp garlic paste,1 tbsp lemon juice,1 tsp red chilli flakes
recipi1.cooking_method: Marinate prawns with garlic paste, lemon juice, and chilli flakes. Melt butter in a pan and add prawns. Cook until pink. Serve hot.

recipi2.name: Rajasthani Laal Maas
recipi2.ingredients: 500g lamb,2 onions,1 tbsp ginger paste,1 tbsp garlic paste,1 tsp red chilli powder
recipi2.cooking_method: Heat oil and fry onions until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and spices. Cook until fragrant. Add lamb and cook until tender. Serve hot.

recipi3.name: Chole Bhature
recipi3.ingredients: 2 cups chickpeas,1 onion,1 tomato,1 tsp ginger paste,1 tsp garlic paste
recipi3.cooking_method: Soak chickpeas overnight. Boil until cooked. Fry onions until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste, tomato, and spices. Cook until thickened. Serve with deep-fried bread (bhature).

name: Madhur Jaffrey
bio: Madhur Jaffrey is a well-known Indian-born actress, author, and culinary expert. She is regarded as one of the foremost authorities on Indian cuisine, and has authored numerous cookbooks, including Madhur Jaffrey's Indian Cooking, Madhur Jaffrey's World Vegetarian, and At Home with Madhur Jaffrey.

recipi1.name: Butter Chicken
recipi1.ingredients: 500g boneless chicken,1 cup yoghurt,1 onion,1 tbsp ginger paste,1 tbsp garlic paste
recipi1.cooking_method: Marinate chicken with yoghurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, and spices. Grill until cooked. For the gravy, heat butter and add onions, ginger-garlic paste, tomato puree, and spices. Cook until thickened. Add the grilled chicken to the gravy and cook for a few minutes. Serve hot.

recipi2.name: Pav Bhaji
recipi2.ingredients: 2 potatoes,2 tomatoes,1 onion,1 capsicum,1 tsp ginger paste
recipi2.cooking_method: Boil and mash potatoes. Fry onions until golden brown. Add ginger paste, tomatoes, and capsicum. Cook until soft. Add mashed potatoes, spices, and butter. Cook until thickened. Serve with buttered buns (pav).

recipi3.name: Rogan Josh
recipi3.ingredients: 500g lamb,2 onions,1 tbsp ginger paste,1 tbsp garlic paste,1 tsp red chilli powder
recipi3.cooking_method: Heat oil and fry onions until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and spices. Cook until fragrant. Add lamb and cook until tender. Serve hot.

name: Anjum Anand
bio: Anjum Anand is a well-known Indian-born British chef, cookbook author, and television personality who specializes in healthy Indian cuisine. She is known for promoting a healthier version of traditional Indian dishes, using fresh, nutritious ingredients and low-fat cooking methods.

recipi1.name: Tandoori Chicken
recipi1.ingredients: 1 whole chicken,1 cup plain yogurt,1 tbsp ginger paste,1 tbsp garlic paste,2 tsp red chili powder
recipi1.cooking_method: Marinate the chicken in the yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, red chili powder, and salt. Let it sit in the fridge for at least an hour. Preheat the oven to 400F. Place the chicken on a baking sheet and bake for about 45 minutes, until fully cooked. Serve hot.

recipi2.name: Aloo Gobi
recipi2.ingredients: 2 potatoes,1 cauliflower,1 onion,1 tbsp ginger paste,1 tbsp garlic paste
recipi2.cooking_method: Heat oil in a pan and add chopped onions. Cook until golden brown. Add ginger paste, garlic paste, and spices. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Add diced potatoes and cauliflower florets. Mix well and cook until tender. Serve hot.

recipi3.name: Lamb Biryani
recipi3.ingredients: 500g lamb,2 cups basmati rice,1 onion,1 tbsp ginger paste,1 tbsp garlic paste
recipi3.cooking_method: Cook the rice and set it aside. Fry onions until golden brown. Add ginger paste, garlic paste, and spices. Cook until fragrant. Add lamb and cook until tender. Layer the cooked rice and lamb mixture in a pot. Cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes. Serve hot.

name: Hari Nayak
bio: Hari Nayak is a renowned Indian-born chef, author, and culinary consultant. He is known for his expertise in Indian cuisine and his innovative cooking style, which combines traditional Indian flavors with modern techniques.

recipi1.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
recipi1.ingredients: 500g boneless chicken,1 cup plain yogurt,1 onion,1 tbsp ginger paste,1 tbsp garlic paste
recipi1.cooking_method: Marinate chicken in yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, and spices. Grill until cooked. For the gravy, heat butter in a pan and fry onions until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste, tomato puree, and spices. Cook until thickened. Add the grilled chicken to the gravy and cook for a few minutes. Serve hot.

recipi2.name: Lamb Vindaloo
recipi2.ingredients: 500g lamb,1 onion,1 tsp ginger paste,1 tsp garlic paste,1 tsp cumin powder
recipi2.cooking_method: Heat oil in a pan and fry onions until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste, cumin powder, and spices. Cook until fragrant. Add lamb and cook until tender. Serve hot.

recipi3.name: Masala Dosa
recipi3.ingredients: 1 cup rice flour,1/2 cup urad dal,1 onion,1 potato,1 tsp cumin seeds
recipi3.cooking_method: Soak rice flour and urad dal in water for 6-8 hours. Grind them into a smooth batter. Ferment the batter overnight. Heat a dosa tawa and spread the batter. Add a little oil and sprinkle cumin seeds. Add diced onions and potato. Cook until golden brown. Serve hot.
